dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The FBI is digging into Tesla's public guidance on the Model 3 production timeline, specifically looking back to early 2018.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The F B I is digging into Tesla's public guidance on the Model three production timeline, specifically looking back to early twenty eighteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Federal Bureau of Investigation is reviewing public statements by the Palo Alto, California-based company dating back to early 2017 to determine if it misled investors based on what it said regarding its ability to produce the Model 3, according to The Wall Street Journal, citing unnamed people familiar with the matter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and according to the Wall Street Journal, they're trying to figure out if the company misled investors with those predictions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and according to the Wall Street Journal, they're trying to figure out if the company misled investors with those predictions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Federal Bureau of Investigation is reviewing public statements by the Palo Alto, California-based company dating back to early 2017 to determine if it misled investors based on what it said regarding its ability to produce the Model 3, according to The Wall Street Journal, citing unnamed people familiar with the matter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, because Elon Musk had said they'd hit 5,000 Model 3s per week by the end of 2018, but it actually took a full year longer to get there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, because Elon Musk had said they'd hit five thousand Model 3s per week by the end of twenty eighteen, but it actually took a full year longer to get there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Musk had said early last year that production of Model 3, currently priced from $46,000, would reach 5,000 units per week in 2017s fourth quarter, and reiterated that target in July 2017 after production of it began in Fremont, California. Ultimately, given difficulties that we did not foresee in this first-of-its-kind production ramp, it took us six months longer than we expected to meet our 5,000 unit per week guidance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And in reality, um, they only built about 2,600 of them total last year—way off from that weekly target.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And in reality, um, they only built about two thousand, six hundred of them total last year-way off from that weekly target.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In fact, the company built only about 2,700 of the cars last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though that Tesla did eventually reach that rate intermittently this year, but their Q3 average was still only 4,200 per week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting though that Tesla did eventually reach that rate intermittently this year, but their Q3 average was still only four thousand, two hundred per week.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although it has reached the 5,000 a week rate intermittently since this years second half, Tesla said in its results letter to shareholders that production averaged 4,300 units a week in the third quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And now former employees are being contacted by the FBI for testimony, which suggests this is a pretty serious criminal investigation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now former employees are being contacted by the F B I for testimony, which suggests this is a pretty serious criminal investigation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Former Tesla employees have been contacted by FBI agents seeking their testimony in a criminal case, the report said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it seems like things really ramped up after Musk's whole SEC settlement over his "taking Tesla private" tweet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it seems like things really ramped up after Musk's whole S E C settlement over his taking Tesla private tweet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The pace of activity in the investigation, which is led by the U.S. attorneys office in San Francisco, intensified after Musk and Tesla settled a dispute with the Securities and Exchange Commission stemming from his tweets in August about taking Tesla private, the report said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which cost him, what, a $20 million fine and stepping down as chairman?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which cost him, what, a twenty dollars million fine and stepping down as chairman?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As part of a settlement concluded this month, Musk agreed to step down as Teslas chairman, a position he assumed long before becoming its CEO, and pay a $20 million fine to settle the matter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly—Tesla had to pay another $20 million too and add independent directors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly-Tesla had to pay another twenty dollars million too and add independent directors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla also must pay a further $20 million and add two independent directors to its board.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But despite all that, the stock surged 15% after their quarterly results. Investors seem… resilient?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But despite all that, the stock surged fifteen percent after their quarterly results. Investors seem... resilient?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla shares surged 15%, or by $42.40, to $330.90 in the days following its surprise quarterly results.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Or maybe just used to the drama. Tesla's defense is that they set "truthful targets," not sandbagged or unrealistic ones.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or maybe just used to the drama. Tesla's defense is that they set truthful targets, not sandbagged or unrealistic ones.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla defended its past statements, and that its philosophy has always been to set truthful targets not sandbagged targets that we would definitely exceed and not unrealistic targets that we could never meet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: They called it "production hell," which, you know, sounds honest—but the FBI's still asking questions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They called it production hell, which, you know, sounds honest-but the F B I's still asking questions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When we started the Model 3 production ramp, we were transparent about how difficult it would be, openly explaining that we would only be able to go as fast as our least lucky or least successful supplier and that we were entering production hell, the company said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And with the U.S. attorney's office in San Francisco leading it, this isn't going away quietly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And with the U.S. attorney's office in San Francisco leading it, this isn't going away quietly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The pace of activity in the investigation, which is led by the U.S. attorneys office in San Francisco, intensified after Musk and Tesla settled a dispute with the Securities and Exchange Commission stemming from his tweets in August about taking Tesla private, the report said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So even as Tesla defends its transparency, there's this lingering question of whether expectations were managed a little too optimistically.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So even as Tesla defends its transparency, there's this lingering question of whether expectations were managed a little too optimistically.
